    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionEntry

        public ConnectionEntry​(java.lang.String alias,
                       java.lang.String address,
                       int port,
                       int roverPort,
                       java.lang.String path,
                       ConnectionEntry.Protocol protocol,
                       int networkTimeout,
                       int bufferTime,
                       int rtspReliable,
                       java.lang.String passphrase,
                       ConnectionEntry.Source source)
        Construct a connection entry that describes all of the fields that could potentially be stored to describe a video source.
        Parameters:
        alias - a human readable alias for the video stream.
        address - the IPv4 address for the video stream.
        port - the port used for the specified video stream.
        roverPort - UDP sideband metadata traffic from a L3 Com Video Downlink Receiver, provide the additional rover port, -1 if there is no data.
        path - for rtsp and http, provide the path to use when connecting to the stream.
        protocol - the protocol for the video stream.
        networkTimeout - as specified in milliseconds (should be 5000).
        bufferTime - as specified in milliseconds (should be -1 unless required).
        passphrase - passphrase to access the source (empty string if not needed)
        source - the source of the saved data, either LOCAL_STORAGE or EXTERNAL (by default should be LOCAL_STORAGE).

      • ConnectionEntry

        public ConnectionEntry​(java.io.File f)
        Construct a connection entry based on the file provided.
        Parameters:
        f - the file

      • ConnectionEntry

        public ConnectionEntry​(java.lang.String alias,
                       java.lang.String uri)
        Creates a connection entry based on a provided uri.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias that is presented to the user that describes the connection entry
        uri - the uri to turn into a connection entry.

      • ConnectionEntry

        public ConnectionEntry()
        Produces a completely undefined ConnectionEntry, a minimum set of values would need to be set before this can even be used. When capable use the full constructor for the connection entry.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public ConnectionEntry copy()
        Construct a copy of the Connection Entry for using by the alternative video player and also for use by the media processor so that the connection entry - if modified does not get messed up. This copy will have a different unique identifier.
        Returns:
        a valid copy of the connection entry with a different unique identifier.

      • copy

        public void copy​(ConnectionEntry from)
        Constructs an exact copy of the ConnectionEntry and even contains the same uid.
        Parameters:
        from - the connection entry to copy the details from.

      • getIgnoreEmbeddedKLV

        public boolean getIgnoreEmbeddedKLV()
        If the connection entry contains embedded klv, ignore it if the flag is true.
        Returns:
        ignore embedded klv if the flag is true.

      • setIgnoreEmbeddedKLV

        public void setIgnoreEmbeddedKLV​(boolean state)
        If the video stream contains metadata, set this flag to hint to the player to ignore any klv processing.
        Parameters:
        state -

      • getRoverPort

        public int getRoverPort()
        Get the port for any sideband metadata - this would be KLV encoded metadata not carried in the same udp stream as the video.
        Returns:
        the port that contains the klv

      • setRoverPort

        public void setRoverPort​(int port)
        Set the port for any sideband metadata - this would be KLV encoded metadata not carried in the same udp stream as the video.
        Parameters:
        port - the port that contains the klv

        public java.lang.String getAlias()

        Returns:
        the alias otherwise the empty string.

      • setAlias

        public void setAlias​(java.lang.String alias)
        Sets the alias for the connection entry.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias to set, if null is passed in a call to getAlias will return the empty string.

      • setPreferredInterfaceAddress

        public void setPreferredInterfaceAddress​(java.lang.String preferredInterfaceAddress)
        Sets the preferred ip address for the interface to use. This is not the ip address associated with the video. Null if using the system level preference for the video traffic. This is specific for multicast video traffic coming in from a single radio.

      • getPreferredInterfaceAddress

        public java.lang.String getPreferredInterfaceAddress()
        Gets the preferred ip address for the interface to use.
        Returns:
        the ip address for the interface to use for the video traffic. This is primarily for multicast video traffic.

      • getRtspReliable

        public int getRtspReliable()
        Returns 1 if rtsp should be force negotiated as reliable (TCP).
        Returns:
        1 if the rtsp stream negotiation should be TCP

      • setRtspReliable

        public void setRtspReliable​(int rtspReliable)
        Set 1 if rtsp should be force negotiated as reliable (TCP).
        Parameters:
        rtspReliable - setting it to 1 will force RTSP to attempt to negotiate a TCP stream

      • setPassphrase

        public void setPassphrase​(java.lang.String pass)
        Set to non-empty string if a passphrase is used to access the video
        Parameters:
        pass - passphrase to access the video or empty string if not needed

      • getPassphrase

        @FortifyFinding(finding="Privacy Violation",
                rational="according to the Fortify flow stack where this is leakage indicated, the password will never print")
public @FortifyFinding(finding="Privacy Violation",rational="according to the Fortify flow stack where this is leakage indicated, the password will never print") java.lang.String getPassphrase()
        Returns non-empty string if one is to be used to access the video source.
        Returns:
        passphrase for the source if used, else empty string

      • getSource

        public ConnectionEntry.Source getSource()
        Gets the source of the Connection Entry (Local or External) used to make sure that it is not persisted incorrectly if it came from the removable card.
        Returns:
        the source of the entry

      • setSource

        public void setSource​(ConnectionEntry.Source source)
        Sets the source of the connection entry. This is used primarily when reading the connection entry as it was persisted.
        Parameters:
        source - the source.

      • getURL

        @FortifyFinding(finding="Password Management: Hardcoded Password",
                rational="XXHiddenXX is a UI password mask and not a password. \'passphrase\' is not a hardcoded password, rather an attribute/field name")
public static @FortifyFinding(finding="Password Management: Hardcoded Password",rational="XXHiddenXX is a UI password mask and not a password. \'passphrase\' is not a hardcoded password, rather an attribute/field name") java.lang.String getURL​(ConnectionEntry ce,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    boolean forDisplay)
        Given a connection entry, produces a well formed URL.
        Parameters:
        forDisplay - true if URL will be displayed or logged or used in some way other than an actual connection to the media. This results in sensitive parts of the URL being obscured.

      • getUserPassIp

        public static java.lang.String[] getUserPassIp​(java.lang.String address)
        Parses out a username and password combination from the provided address or url
        Parameters:
        address - the address of url
        Returns:
        an array of length 3, with the username being in position 0, password being in position 1 and the address or rest of the url being in position 2.
